title: quarkus-resteasy does not properly guard against invalid URLs
body:
### Describe the bug

During an automated fuzzing session, we discovered that quarkus-resteasy doesn't deal well with malformed URLs. Basically, since `VertxUtil#extractUriInfo` is called very early on in request processing, its failure will lead to a 500 (and possibly a stacktrace) where it really should be a 400.
To make that function fail, you can use invalid URL encoding - e.g., do `/%FF`. You'll end up with a `java.nio.charset.MalformedInputException`.
This isn't a security-critical issue, but on the other hand it also shouldn't flood your logs with stacktraces.

### Expected behavior

The call should return HTTP 400, Bad Request.

### Actual behavior

Instead, we get a HTTP 500, possibly including a full stacktrace. For the reproducer below, you'll get
```
< HTTP/1.1 500 Internal Server Error
< content-type: application/json; charset=utf-8
< content-length: 1917
< 
* Connection #0 to host localhost left intact
{"details":"Error id a7604c2a-41c6-40f9-9f3f-8eae21129131-3, java.lang.RuntimeException: java.nio.charset.MalformedInputException: Input length = 1","stack":"java.lang.RuntimeException: java.nio.charset.MalformedInputException: Input length = 1\n\tat org.jboss.resteasy.util.Encode.decodeBytes(Encode.java:252)\n\tat org.jboss.resteasy.util.Encode.decodePath(Encode.java:228)\n\tat org.jboss.resteasy.specimpl.ResteasyUriInfo$InitData.<init>(ResteasyUriInfo.java:577)\n\tat org.jboss.resteasy.specimpl.ResteasyUriInfo.initialize(ResteasyUriInfo.java:73)\n\tat org.jboss.resteasy.specimpl.ResteasyUriInfo.<init>(ResteasyUriInfo.java:65)\n\tat org.jboss.resteasy.specimpl.ResteasyUriInfo.<init>(ResteasyUriInfo.java:56)\n\tat io.quarkus.resteasy.runtime.standalone.VertxUtil.extractUriInfo(VertxUtil.java:52)\n\tat io.quarkus.resteasy.runtime.standalone.VertxRequestHandler.dispatch(VertxRequestHandler.java:117)\n\tat io.quarkus.resteasy.runtime.standalone.VertxRequestHandler$1.run(VertxRequestHandler.java:90)\n\tat io.quarkus.vertx.core.runtime.VertxCoreRecorder$13.runWith(VertxCoreRecorder.java:543)\n\tat org.jboss.threads.EnhancedQueueExecutor$Task.run(EnhancedQueueExecutor.java:2449)\n\tat org.jboss.threads.EnhancedQueueExecutor$ThreadBody.run(EnhancedQueueExecutor.java:1478)\n\tat org.jboss.threads.DelegatingRunnable.run(DelegatingRunnable.java:29)\n\tat org.jboss.threads.ThreadLocalResettingRunnable.run(ThreadLocalResettingRunnable.java:29)\n\tat io.netty.util.concurrent.FastThreadLocalRunnable.run(FastThreadLocalRunnable.java:30)\n\tat java.base/java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:833)\nCaused by: java.nio.charset.MalformedInputException: Input length = 1\n\tat java.base/java.nio.charset.CoderResult.throwException(CoderResult.java:274)\n\tat java.base/java.nio.charset.CharsetDecoder.decode(CharsetDecoder.java:820)\n\tat org.jboss.resteasy.util.Encode.decodeBytes(Encode.java:248)\n\t... 15 more"}
```

### How to Reproduce?

The simplest way to reproduce is is using the example project:
```
git clone https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus-quickstarts.git
cd quarkus-quickstarts
./mvnw compile quarkus:dev
```
and then, in another terminal
```
curl -v http://localhost:8080/fruits/%FF
```

### Output of `uname -a` or `ver`

Darwin hostname.local 21.1.0 Darwin Kernel Version 21.1.0: Wed Oct 13 17:33:01 PDT 2021; root:xnu-8019.41.5~1/RELEASE_ARM64_T6000 arm64
